description.value: perceptual property in music ordering sounds from low to high

annotation_type.label: pitch
annotation_type.description: perceptual property in music ordering sounds from low to high

annotation_type.label: custos
annotation_type.description: musical symbol at the end of a musical staff, analogous in fuction to a catchword

annotation_type.label: ossia
annotation_type.description: musical term

annotation_type.label: solmization
annotation_type.description: system associating syllables to musical notes

annotation_type.label: figured bass
annotation_type.description: musical notation in which numerals/accidentals show chords to be played in relation to the bass note, used in Baroque music

annotation_type.label: Roman numeral analysis
annotation_type.description: Use of Roman numeral symbols in the musical analysis of chords

annotation_type.label: chord symbol
annotation_type.description: system for naming chords

annotation_type.label: arpeggio
annotation_type.description: notes in a chord played in sequence

annotation_type.label: trill
annotation_type.description: musical ornament consisting of a rapid alternation between two adjacent notes, usually a semitone or tone apart

annotation_type.label: mordent
annotation_type.description: musical ornament, consisting of a single alternation with the note above or below

annotation_type.label: turn
annotation_type.description: musical ornament

annotation_type.label: appoggiatura
annotation_type.description: Musical ornament

annotation_type.label: double appoggiatura
annotation_type.description: musical ornament

annotation_type.label: glissando
annotation_type.description: glide from one pitch to another

annotation_type.label: ad libitum
annotation_type.description: Latin expression for "at one's pleasure"

annotation_type.label: musica ficta
annotation_type.description: renaissance European music theory term to describe pitches

annotation_type.label: natural sign
annotation_type.description: musical sign (accidental) cancelling previous accidentals returning the frequency of the note to the natural/original value

annotation_type.label: clef
annotation_type.description: musical symbol used to indicate the pitch of written notes

annotation_type.label: flat sign
annotation_type.description: musical sign (accidental) lowering the pitch of a note by one chromatic semitone (factor 2^(1/12))

annotation_type.label: sharp sign
annotation_type.description: musical sign (accidental) raising the pitch of a note by one chromatic semitone (factor 2^(1/12))

annotation_type.label: realization of figured bass
annotation_type.description: practice of expanding figured bass notation into a full accompaniment

annotation_type.label: voice leading
annotation_type.description: decision-making consideration when arranging voices in musical composition

annotation_type.label: transposition
annotation_type.description: operation in music of moving multiple notes by the same interval

annotation_type.label: colla parte
annotation_type.description: Musical indication to play another, written-out part, or to an accompanist to look to the main part for guidance on tempo

annotation_type.label: cadenza
annotation_type.description: improvised or written-out ornamental passage played or sung by a soloist or soloists

annotation_type.label: tremolo
annotation_type.description: musical term for rapid repetition of a note

annotation_type.label: ornament
annotation_type.description: musical flourishes that are not necessary to carry the overall line of the melody (or harmony), but serve instead to decorate or "ornament" that line

annotation_type.label: vibrato
annotation_type.description: regular, pulsating change of pitch in music

annotation_type.label: octave sign
annotation_type.description: Music symbol referring to a phrase or a section of music to be played one octave higher

annotation_type.label: accidental
annotation_type.description: note whose pitch is not a member of the scale or mode indicated by the most recently applied key signature

annotation_type.label: organ stop
annotation_type.description: part of a pipe organ

annotation_type.label: portamento
annotation_type.description: pitch sliding from one note to another
